At that time, the sea god, having heard these words, gave rise to fear in his mind, and thought like this:

Chapter 35: The Two Merchants Offering Food, Part 1 of 35 At that time, the World-Honored One had just attained enlightenment and sat under the tree for seven days and nights, cross-legged without rising, taking the bliss of liberation as his food.

At that time, the World-Honored One, after seven days, with right mindfulness and right recollection, arose from samÄdhi, sat on the lion seat, and in the first watch of the night, contemplated the twelve links of dependent origination, observing from below to above and from above to below, with good thoughts and good contemplation, without loss or deviation. He saw that this arises due to that, and that this exists due to the existence of that. At that time, the World-Honored One, having understood this Dharma, spoke a verse, saying:

If one sees all dharmas arising from characteristics, one will know that all dharmas exist due to causes and conditions.

At that time, the World-Honored One, in the middle of the night, contemplated the twelve links of dependent origination, from beginning to end, contemplating in reverse with a focused mind, contemplating well and thinking well, without losing or being disturbed.
